messageBody:
On Monday 21 February 2005 05:27, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Michael Schuerig wrote:

> > Now I'm looking for an easy way to create the tables in the
> > in-memory database that ensures consistency with the production
> > database. The latter is managed by HSQLDB in this particular case,
> > too, but that's not necessarily so, of course.
>
> I assume you have scripts that automatically create a production
> database, and that those are DDL scripts. Can you not just use those?

Actually, I don't have plain scripts, the DDL statements are in an Ant
build file (using the sql-task), but it's no problem to extract them.
Is there a convenient way to execute these scripts from a junit test?

Michael
